page.title: 20Wool Village....the Springs
page.content: "This village,"says Hutchins,"stands in Great Bindon Liberty,nearthe south bank of the River Frome,a mile and a half northwest from Coombe Kaynes (Coombe Keynes). It seems to derive its ancient name Welle from the springs that abound there;and there is good reason why this village should bear this name...from a beautiful stream of water which rises,or wells up in a body,at the headof a small meadow about 200yards above it, on the south side towards Combe Kaynes". Today(1985)the stream still runs down Spring Street towards Bindon Abbey where it joins the River Frome,which winds on to Wareham and then to Poole Harbour.
